choices.D: A WAN Edge router is behind NAT.
choices.B: Generally, they provide a higher bandwidth for tunnel connection.

discussion.content: D , E , GRE not support NAT neither encryption.

i think A&E is correct. because The IPsec Dead Peer Detection Periodic Message Option feature is used to configure the router to query the liveliness of its Internet Key Exchange (IKE) peer at regular intervals. The benefit of this approach over the default approach (on-demand dead peer detection) is earlier detection of dead peers.

Selected Answer: DE
GRE tunnels require that the WAN Edge routers have public IP addresses. IPsec tunnels can be used with WAN Edge routers that are behind NAT.
D and E

questions.question_text: What are the two reasons a customer chooses to use IPsec tunnels over GRE? (Choose two.)

An enterprise is continuously adding new sites to its Cisco SD-WAN network. It must configure any cached routes flushed when OMP peers have lost adjacency.

Which configuration allows the cached OMP routes to be flushed after every 24 hours from its routing table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct anser is A, 24hr change to minutes (24x60)=1440minutes, then change to seconds (1440x60)=86400 seconds

Selected Answer: A
given answer is correct.

questions.question_text:
A company deploys a Cisco SD-WAN solution but has an unstable Internet connection. When the link to vSmart comes back up, the WAN Edge router routing table is not refreshed, and some traffic to the destination network is dropped. The headquarters is the hub site, and it continuously adds new sites to the SD-WAN network. An engineer must configure route refresh between WAN Edge and vSmart within 2 minutes.

Which configuration meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Seems to be D

eor-timer seconds
 

End-of-RIB Timer:

Specifies how long to wait after an OMP session has gone down and then come back up to send an end-of-RIB (EOR) marker. After this marker is sent, any routes that weren’t refreshed after the OMP session came back up are considered to be stale and are deleted from the route table.

Range: 1–3600 seconds (1 hour)

Default: 300 seconds (5 minutes)

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/iosxe/qualified-cli-command-reference-guide/m-omp-commands.html

Selected Answer: B
I think it's B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/sdwan-cr-book/config-cmd.html#r_timers_7662.xml

Badly worded question, especially use of the word "within." The EOR timer dictates when, after regaining vSmart connection, the Edge router sends the EOR message to vSmart, telling it to delete any routes that it has not just sent since regaining the connection. Not quite what the question asks for, but better than the other choices.

Selected Answer: D
Ans : D

End-of-RIB Timer:

Specifies how long to wait after an OMP session has gone down and then come back up to send an end-of-RIB (EOR) marker. After this marker is sent, any routes that weren’t refreshed after the OMP session came back up are considered to be stale and are deleted from the route table.

comments.content: when holdtime expires it closed the OMP connection to the peer. it does not seem to be related to route refresh
the eor timer is the one that refreshes the routing table after the hold time expires which is what the question is asking for ???

discussion.content:
The graceful-restart command followed by the holdtime is the correct syntax.
(Coincidently, I was configuring this today for a customer lol )

Sytax is 
 OMP
 no shutdown
 discard-rejected
 graceful-restart
 timers
 holdtime [In Seconds]
 exit

Option [A]
At the question is specifying the LAN segment, if you do not specify this, all ranges will be routed by default.

The answer is D.
Advertising has been pre-selected from the HUB to the spokes by the checkbox, no need to specify the LAN segment (This is optional).

questions.question_text:
After deploying Cisco SD-WAN, the company realized that by default, all sites built direct IPsec VPN tunnels to each other. In their previous topology, all spoke sites used the head office as their next hop for the LAN segment that belongs to network 40.0.0.0/16. The company wants to deploy its previous policy, which allows the 40.0.0.0/16 network that originates at the hub to advertise to the spokes.

Which configuration meets the requirement?

choices.C: installs the controllers in two cloud regions in a primary and backup setup
choices.E: automatically implements zone-based firewalling on the controllers
choices.D: allows integration of the WAN Edge devices in the cloud
choices.A: utilizes well-known cloud services such as Azure, AWS, and GCP

discussion.content: Correct are A B C

Selected Answer: BC
the correct is BC, this web page from September 2024 states that " The following clouds and cloud regions are supported for Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller deployments: Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure, not mention at Google.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/knowledge-base/CloudOps/b-cisco-sdwan-cloudops/m-cloudops-overview.html
I think B,C

comments.content: Not correct, Azuer and GCP are supported.

From official book
Chapter 2 - Cisco SD-WAN Components
Deployment Options
Currently supported private clouds are Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure.
So I'll go with B and C.

discussion.content:
There was quiz from the CBT Nuggets video course, instructor Jeff Kish
Question: Where does Cisco's cloud service live?
Answer: AWS (not Azure or GCP)

Selected Answer: AB
C can also be part of the answer, but A and B is my answer

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/benefits.html#~stickynav=1
I would say that C,D,E are wrong, so I vote for A,B as correct answers

Selected Answer: BC
I think B and C are correct.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of installing Cisco SD-WAN controllers on cloud-hosted services? (Choose two.)
